intro: Calyptranthes anceps, commonly known as the Hawaiian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are evergreen, glossy, and elliptical in shape, providing a dense foliage. Calyptranthes anceps thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in rainforest habitats.
